itemDescription: British recipient of the Victoria Cross

wikipedia_page.main: Major General William Spottiswoode Trevor VC (9 October 1831 – 2 November 1907) was a recipient of the Victoria Cross, the highest and most prestigious award for gallantry in the face of the enemy that can be awarded to British and Commonwealth forces.

link_mentions.page: List of Victoria Cross recipients of uncertain nationality

response: Dundas was 22 years old, and a lieutenant in the Bengal Engineers, Indian Army during the Bhutan War when the following deed took place on 30 April 1865 at Dewan-Giri, Bhutan for which he was awarded the VC in a joint citation with Major William Spottiswoode Trevor:

link_mentions.page: List of burials at Kensal Green Cemetery
response: * Major Gen. William Spottiswoode Trevor VC (1831–1907)

Trevor was born in Jalalabad, the son of Robert Salusbury Trevor and Mary Spottiswoode. At the time of his birth, his father was a captain with the 3rd Bengal Cavalry serving in the First Anglo-Afghan War. His father was killed in the course of the war and his family were amongst the hostages held by the Afghans until rescued during General Pollock's reoccupation of Kabul in 1842.Minutes of Proceedings of the Institution of Civil Engineers. United Kingdom, The Institution, 1896. An elder brother was William Spottiswoode Trevor.
